result.execSummary:
The defendant James Irvin. Mezera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: No Huber. Defendant entitled to good time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
2:16 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant James Irvin. Mezera in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Steiner is heard on the status of the case. 
Defendant is heard.  They have come to resolution. Proceeding with plea and sentencing for count 2. 

State requests $300.00 plus court costs of count 2.   
Court takes a break;  court resumes 2:24 pm 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a no contest plea. Court accepts the defendants no contest plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

Court advises right to an attorney.  
Attorney Steiner is heard. 
No comment by defendant. 

Court orders for count 2...Fine of $300.00 plus court costs.  $831.00.  Any bond left to be applied. $623.00 left after bond applied.

11:17 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant James Irvin. Mezera appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard, not prepared to take any action to dispose of the pending count. 
Court leaves matter on for JSH in August.
Status hearing on August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:00 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant James Irvin. Mezera in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea and sentencing for count 1 only.  

Defendant is heard and requests to proceed without and attorney. 

10:01 AM Break for Defendant to complete paperwork to proceed. 
10:10 AM Court resumes. 

Court reviews waiver of right to attorney with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea for count 1. Defendant enters a guilty plea. Court accepts the defendants guilty plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

State is heard on sentencing. State recommends 10 days jail with good time. Restitution requested. Bond posted applied. 
Defendant is heard. Requests lessor jail time than recommended. 
Court orders 20 days jail with good time. Credit for 1/4 of that time. No Huber. Bond posted to be applied to cover the Restitution owed to the officer. $792.00 The court will hold the remainder of the bond for the second count. No fine. Court costs of $443.00 60DTP.  Defendant to be remanded today. 

JSH for count 2 to be scheduled.
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant requested to represent himself. Upon request, waiver of attorney form and plea questionnaire and waiver forms were provided to defendant along with the notice of hearing.

10:00 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant James Irvin. Mezera appeared by video, in custody in Crawford County Jail.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $500.00 cash bond. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages, nor enter any taverns. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Status hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages, nor enter any taverns. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
